medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported intermittent pain in the right upper and lower quadrants of the abdomen for 6 weeks. The pain worsened with food intake and usually subsided within 1 to 2 hours after taking antacids. On this occasion, the pain was severe, lasted for 8 hours, and was followed by nonbloody, nonbilious emesis. No fever or chills were present.
